content.question: Which of the following developments in the late twentieth century would most likely be cited to explain a flaw in Soros’ arguments regarding “social needs” and “collective decision making” in the first paragraph?

choices.label: The Soviet Union and other communist states in Eastern Europe collapsed largely because of economic inefficiencies created by centralized economic planning and attempts to eliminate all economic and social inequalities.
Governments in the Asia-Pacific region and Latin America often offered generous tax incentives to Western multinational corporations to relocate manufacturing facilities to their countries.
Technological innovations enhanced global communication and led to the development of knowledge economies.
The emergence of major financial crises in Asia still did not convince governments about the need to enact banking and stock-market reforms.

content.answer: The Soviet Union and other communist states in Eastern Europe collapsed largely because of economic inefficiencies created by centralized economic planning and attempts to eliminate all economic and social inequalities.
